pullRequest.title: Enable OSS support in TOKENGEN and TOKENDUMP for the secret management

commit.message: Enable OSS support in TOKENGEN and TOKENDUMP for the secret management

nodes.bodyText:
Don't call getKeyStore multiple times, the whole keystore gets cloned when you do so.
Specify StandardCharsets.UTF_8 when creating the String instance.
Add a comment here and in the documentation templates explaining that warp.key.token.secret will prevail if it exists.
This part of the PR doesn't have much to do with the rest!

commit.message:
Revert "Clean up useless imports"

This reverts commit 5bb0cca5
Enable OSS support in TOKENGEN and TOKENDUMP for the secret management
Specify StandardCharsets.UTF_8 when creating the String instance.

nodes.bodyText: Extract the key only once with nested ifs.

Use separate constants to make the code clearer, even though they have the same value. CONF_TOKEN_SECRET for the configuration key, KEY_TOKEN_SECRET for the KeyStore key. Clearly describe the behavior in the comments. As it is now it is rather hard to understand since you say "Myst be warp.key.token.secret is handled by OSS" with a constant defined below. What should I do if I want to use OSS? Recompile the code with a different value of CONF_TOKEN_SECRET?

commit.message: Use separate constants to make the code clearer and extract the key only once.

nodes.bodyText:
Unwrapping of any configuration key prefixed with Configuration.WARP_KEY_PREFIX is automatic, the only thing you have to do is to attempt to retrieve the KEY_TOKEN_SECRET key and use it if it is set.
So KEY_TOKEN_SECRET should be "token.secret"
You need to modify the distributed configuration template too.
Explain more clearly how this is taken into account vs token.secret
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -50,9 +50,14 @@
 #warpscript.extension.sensision = io.warp10.script.ext.sensision.SensisionWarpScriptExtension
 // MUTEX, SHMLOAD, SHMSTORE
 #warpscript.extension.shm = io.warp10.script.ext.shm.SharedMemoryWarpScriptExtension
+
 // TOKENDUMP, TOKENGEN, TOKENSECRET
 #warpscript.extension.token = io.warp10.script.ext.token.TokenWarpScriptExtension
+// If you use OSS to handle this secret

commit.message: Update configuration templates and fix the constant.

nodes.bodyText: It's actually the name of the secret in the key store, not in the configuration.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,7 +35,7 @@
    * Name of configuration key with OSS wrapped token secret

nodes.bodyText: This should test the existence of the key in the keystore, i.e. Warp.getKeyStore().getKey(KEY_TOKEN_SECRET) and then set TOKEN_SECRET accordingly, here this would always set TOKEN_SECRET to null since you already checked the same configuration key.
Rename this variable ks so it differs frankly from keystore

commit.message: Variable renaming, conf keys test fix
Simplify tests of token secret keys existence.
